medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient experienced right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain that began 5 hours ago and was constant for 4 hours. The pain felt similar to previous episodes of pancreatitis and cholangitis. The patient also started vomiting nonbilious contents around the same time. Home temperature was recorded at 99.6. At present, the patient reports that the pain has improved.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Legally blind; atrial fibrillation not on anticoagulation; hyperlipidemia; angina with multiple negative workups; lung cancer with right lower lobe nodule status post thoracotomy with right lower lobectomy, stage IA or IB; gastroesophageal reflux disease; retinitis pigmentosa; hypothyroidism.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother died of unknown causes, and her father also died of unknown causes. She denies any history of colon or gastrointestinal cancer.
